title: Landfill Mining + Land Reclamation: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: Excavate legacy dumps for material recovery + land value restoration

nodes.label: Waste
nodes.description: Landfill Mining: Excavate legacy dumps for recovery + reclamation

nodes.label: Urban Development
nodes.description: Land value, city planning, real estate

links.quantification: Land reclamation → 50K ha dumps restored → ₹5L Cr urban land value unlocked → real estate/parks/infrastructure development
Material recovery → 30% recyclables, 40% soil-like refuse → ₹10K Cr material value + ₹5K Cr compost market
Fire elimination → PM2.5 hotspots removed → respiratory hospitalizations -40% in adjacent areas → ₹2K Cr health benefits
Leachate source removal → groundwater contamination stops → 500M m³/year aquifer recovery → ₹3K Cr remediation avoided
Mining costs: ₹20K Cr to excavate 200 MT legacy waste → municipal budgets insufficient → PPP/central funding required
Material quality: Legacy waste 70% contaminated/degraded → low recyclability → recovery economics marginal without subsidy
Restoration → native species reintroduced → ecosystem services recover → carbon sequestration → climate benefits (reinforcing)
Requires land use planning: Mining only viable if reclaimed land designated for high-value use → master plan integration prerequisite
links.citation: Thesis: Landfill land use planning linkage

links.quantification: Via fire elimination: PM2.5 reduction → property values near dumps increase 30% → community wealth improves
links.citation: Thesis: Air quality real estate impacts

links.quantification: Via urban greening: Restored dump land → parks/green corridors → recreation access → ₹1K Cr health/wellbeing benefits
Via groundwater recovery: Leachate elimination → well water safe → community water security improves → ₹500 Cr treatment savings
